thread.title: Air Canada: Brisbane lands direct flights to Vancouver | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The
thread.title_full: Air Canada: Brisbane lands direct flights to Vancouver | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Robyn Ironside
title: Air Canada: Brisbane lands direct flights to Vancouver | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The
text:
AUSTRALIANS will soon have another way of getting to a country where the dollar is still worth something.
Air Canada has announced it will begin direct flights between Brisbane and Vancouver from next June.
It will be the second Australian destination serviced by the airline, which operates a daily service from Sydney.
The new three-times a week service to Vancouver from Brisbane will cut five hours from the trip for travellers who currently have to fly via Sydney, or through Los Angeles. Hello Vancouver ... the Canadian city is about to get closer to Brisbane thanks to a new direct service by Air Canada. Picture: Tourism British Columbia Source: Supplied
In the year to May, 125,600 Aussies headed to Canada, where our dollar is worth significantly more (0.94 cents) than across the border in the US (0.74 cents).
Air Canada will put its new Dreamliner on the Brisbane service, providing 1500 seats a week.
Brisbane Airport Corporation CEO Julieanne Alroe said the flights represented a “milestone achievement” for BNE.
“We’ve been in negotiations for the past two years working in partnership with Air Canada, Vancouver Airport, Tourism and Events Queensland and Tourism Australia,” said Ms Alroe.
“Canadian travellers are at an highest high to Queensland and with the strong corporate links between our state and Canada due to the resource sector, I’d like to thank all of our partners who have helped make this happen.” Great city ... Vancouver will soon be under 14-hours away from Brisbane. Pic: News Corp Australia Source: News Corp Australia
Brisbane will be the second Australian destination for Air Canada which already operates a daily year-round service out of Sydney.
Queensland Tourism Minister Kate Jones said the new flights would help attract an extra 12,000 international visitors to the State each year.
“The Air Canada service represents the first direct flight between Queensland and Canada, and is
expected to inject up to $24 million in visitor expenditure for Queensland’s economy a year,”
Minister Jones said.
“The new direct route better connects the state with the growing North American visitor market, which recorded a nine per cent growth in visitation in the year ending December 2014.”
Incentives had been offered to Air Canada, under the government’s Attracting Aviation Investment Fund, Ms Jones said. Rocky Mountaineer coastal passage route 2:07 Play video
The majestic Canadian Rockies are now closer to Seattle with the introduction of our new Coastal Passage route. This unique rail experience connects the cosmopolitan cities of Seattle, Washington and Vancouver, B.C. to the Canadian Rockies
news.com.au 01 Mar 2015 News Within reach ... Vancouver is a stone’s throw to the renowned Whistler Blackcomb ski resort. Source: Supplied
“Growing aviation services to Queensland helps support the state’s tourism economy and creates
jobs,” she said.
Tickets for the first flights in June 2016, will go on sale from next Thursday (July 16).
Air Canada’s 787-8 has three cabins, including Business with 20 lie-flat suite seats, Premium Economy (21) and Economy (210).
Flight time will be around 13 hours and 35 minutes. Currently the shortest journey available to Brisbane travellers to Vancouver is 18 hours and 45 minutes.
